works.title: Integrity Test
works.description: The main purpose of the integrity test is to identify potential vulnerabilities of individuals who are in the imminent hiring phase (~80% of situations) or in the period immediately following hiring (~20% of situations). The information presented by the candidate does not always reflect the true state of affairs. It is possible that the new employee may have one or more vulnerabilities that could negatively interfere with the nature and specifics of the activities carried out. Following such a polygraph examination, we establish the existence or non-existence of personal vulnerabilities and, at the same time, what is the degree of risk assumed by the employing company.

works.title: Preventive Polygraph Test
works.description: Widely used in various fields of activity, the examination is repetitive at intervals of 3, 6, or 12 months, and the questions asked are constructed exclusively from the employee's sphere of activity. The purpose of the test is to establish whether the person examined has had honest conduct at their workplace in the interval between the previous examination and the current one. In case possible fraudulent actions are identified, administrative investigations will be arranged regarding the person / area of activity / deed committed / damage caused.

works.title: Thematic Polygraph Testing
works.description: Represents a well-developed/formally structured procedure and aims to clarify the potential involvement or non-involvement of a person in a controversial event. It also establishes the form of participation (author, co-author, accomplice, instigator, concealer, etc.). The fee for an examination depends on the complexity of the case. The first case tested with a polygraph is free!
